sentences: Rida on hea näiteks lihtsate asjade kohta.
Rida võib tähendada ka järjekorda või reast.
Mul oli rida mõtteid selle kohta.
context: In Estonian, 'rida' is a versatile word that primarily means 'line' or 'row', referring to an arrangement of items in a straight line. It can also mean 'queue' when referring to people waiting in order, and sometimes 'string' as in a series of things connected together. The word can be used both literally (like a row of chairs) and figuratively (a line of thought).
